channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: White line worn out drivers cut corner and fail to stop, 13th September
item.description:

item.title: Street light not working on Washpool Road, 12th September
item.description:
Street light outside 49 washpool Road is not working, creating a dark unsafe area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Washpool Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurrence of previous problem, 12th September
item.description:
Unsurprisingly the hole I reported a month ago and said needed a permanent repair, which you only then patched, has now recurred,.. exactly as I predicted it would. It’s terrible again now and needs to be sorted out. The actual definition of false economy to not resurface this properly. When will this cycle end??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole/drain cover in road, 12th September
item.description:
Location on the map is approximate - the issue is just beyond Noake Court Farm when travelling towards Churchdown from Gloucester. The manhole/drain is very sunken, and just around a bend so very difficult to avoid safely. It could cause significant damage to cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water seeping through road surface., 12th September
item.description:
Starts opposite number 4 and then all down the road. Potholes have been patched multiple times over running water without a proper attempt to resolve the root problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: These lights have been faulty and stuck on red for weeks on end. It is causing dangerous conditions on this road every day and congested traffic making the roundabout dangerous, 12th September
item.description:
Temp traffic lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Painswick Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: After minimal rain today, the Toucan crossing on A 40 at end of Shelburne Rd. Crossing is unusable for pedestrians and hazardous for cycles., 12th September
item.description:
I know this has already been reported, but removing the problem needs to be expedited. The logic in having the primary location via a postcode is ridiculous unless you're going to label all the streets with postcodes. I have no idea how to find a postcode for that area, and shouldn't have to try.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88a, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: VERY noisy drain cover, 12th September
item.description:
There are two drain covers in the road kerbside (Winchcombe Street) which makes a very loud CLACK CLACK each time a vehicle goes over it. This is day or night and has been going on for months. It needs fixing urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Winchcombe Street, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 12th September
item.description:
I’m very interested to hear your thoughts. We do love the tree and it is on a tree lined cul de sac but it does need some attention as do one or two others in the road. New trees have been planted over the years but no maintenance has been done.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 12th September
item.description:
The street light outside numbers 4, 6 and 10 Hall Road are NOT turning on in the evening despite previous reports being recently marked as fixed. The problem has not been fixed. At 8:30pm last night (11th Sept) these lights were off where the rest of the lights in the street were on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Hall Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect signage for Cheltenham Rd Closure (again), 11th September
item.description:
The signs on elm bridge court advertise that Cheltenham road east is closed at Heathdean and to follow the diversion, the diversion takes you around to the hare and hounds which is where there closure actually is. As a resident of St Johns Avenue this meant driving up and down the A40 twice due to the incorrect signage. This is the 2nd time during these resurfacing works reporting incorrect signage for residents and 3rd time in the last year
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings, 11th September
item.description:
New road markings are now showing two straight arrows entering from bishops cleeve side and from Swindon village direction on race course roundabout...two lanes going into one , major accident waiting to happen who thought this was a good idea ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: There have been temporary lights for 6 weeks - and no sign of any work being carried out . Why? and when will work start and finish?, 11th September
item.description:
A435 next to the Racecourse. That same bit of road has subsided before over the last 20 years and was not fixed properly last time this happened.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Cold Pool Lane - consider no right turn, 11th September
item.description:
Each morning, Cold Pool Lane is full of queuing cars due to the railway bridge closure. As the railway bridge is going to be months before repair and the road is open, please consider traffic exiting cold Pool Lane as left turn only and block off right turn. The traffic build up in the lane is purely down to cars who want to turn right but are unable too due to amount of traffic on main road. Making it left turn only would make the lane free flowing and anyone wanting to turn right can go upto the roundabout and back on themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues
